result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Todd A Pionek was found guilty of OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond applied, see assessment report.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises or remain upon any premises where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Cash bond applied.  See assessment report.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant eligible to earn good time.
Defendant to serve 48 hours, then be released on a 2 day furlough and then return to serve remaining sentence.

records.addlTxt: copy to defendant, jail, prison and DOC
Zoom - ADA Zier, defendant - in custody
various letters
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Todd A Pionek in court/custody via zoom with attorney Katena Roberts-Turner appearing in court.  ADA Zier appeared for the State of Wisconsin via zoom.  
Plea quest. filed in 20CF190.  20CF190 Def. plea guilty.  Court informs def. of his rights and questions the defendant and counsel.  Court finds def. is waiving his rights and vol. entering his plea. Court finds the defendant guilty of the charge OWI 8th offense.  Court dismisses 20TR1493.
Stmt. by Atty. Zier and Atty. Roberts-Turner regarding sentencing.
Atty. Roberts-Turner provided Ltrs. of support on behalf of the def. provided to the Court.
Stmt. by the defendant. 
Court orders - 
14CF302/15CF22 - 4 yrs. on each case with 2 yrs. initial confinement and 2 yrs. extended supv. to run concurrent with each other. Court orders civil judgment for financial obligations.   Court Grant credit 449 days in the matters.
20CF190 - 6 yrs. 3 yrs of initial confinement with  3 yrs of extended supervision consecutive to 14CF302/15CF22.  Court directs the sentence to begin forthwith.  Court directs that the defendant is eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse program.  Court informs defendant of post conviciton relief. Court provides defendant with information on determinate sentence.  Other documents such as voting and firearms will be sent to the defendant at the jail.  Court grants credit of 157 days on 20CF190.  Stmt. by ADA Zier re:  Credit. 
Court directs that any  financial obligations in 20CF190 can be taken out of the cash bond posted and any balance returned to the party that posted.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 28, 2020 at 02:30 pm.
